summary: This is a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney transmitting an unredacted copy of Exhibit F (a sealed Government Memorandum) in the U.S. v. Maxwell appellate case. The document indicates the Government sought to file the exhibit under seal but had not yet received an order on that motion.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Submitted the email transmitting the unredacted copy of Exhibit F in the U.S. v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Transmission of Unredacted Exhibit F
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emailed an unredacted copy of Exhibit F (a Government Memorandum) in the U.S. v. Maxwell appellate case.

events.title: Government Memorandum Filed
events.description: The Government filed a memorandum (Exhibit F) that was later submitted in redacted form by the defendant-appellant.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a cover email transmitting an unredacted copy of Exhibit F in the U.S. v. Maxwell appellate case (dockets 21-58, 21-770).
Exhibit F is a Government Memorandum dated December 16, 2020, that was filed publicly by the defendant-appellant in redacted form.
The Government sought permission to file this document under seal but had not yet received an order on their motion as of April 12, 2021.
The email was sent by an Assistant United States Attorney from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
